title: Weird and wonderful things left behind by people selling cars
text:

Considering how much time we spend driving, it’s nice to put your own stamp on a car.

With the average Briton spending nine hours behind the wheel each week, time is bound to go by quicker with the help of a few personal touches - whether it be a sweet-smelling air freshener or a collection of CDs (that’s definitely better than anyone else’s).

However, some motorists are more eccentric with their approach to interior design.

The UK’s favourite car buying service, webuyanycar.com, has revealed the most weird and wonderful items that awaited unsuspecting customers after being left behind by previous owners.

From the funny to the downright shocking, here are the strangest things found in cars that’ll make you think about checking your glove compartment a second time before selling...

A four year out-of-date tin of baked beans

We all like a snack on a long drive. But baked beans just seems like an impractical choice for the roads.

(Image: Getty Images)

Maybe this was what caused someone to leave a tin wedged underneath their passenger seat, only to be found by a shocked webuyanycar.com buyer in Wrexham.

Even more concerning was that the four-year-old tin was found three years into the ownership - meaning they’d been chauffeuring the rotting beans around the entire time!

A... blood transfusion machine?

If you’ve ever misplaced something - be it a phone or a wallet - you will know that getting it back can feel like your life depends on it.

Well, sometimes it just might. Sister company to webuyanycar.com, webuyanyvan.com, reported that one customer found a blood transfusion machine in their new purchase.

While the device wouldn’t look out of place in the back of an ambulance, the discovery was made in second-hand van bought in Coventry.

Box of human ashes

Earlier this year, a customer visited the Altrincham branch to sell his late father’s car.

When the car was later moved, the buyer was shocked to find that the customer had left behind a box - containing his father’s ashes.

Thankfully, it didn’t take long for the customer to be reunited with the ashes.

Another grave discovery was once made in Norwich, where a buyer found an order of service from the customer’s mother’s funeral.

An envelope with £10,000 in cash

Not all discoveries have to bad. Cash is one of the most common items to be mistakenly left behind in cars.

The biggest amount discovered to date is an impressive £10,000, found in a large envelope beneath the passenger seat in Melksham.

Unsurprisingly, this is one item the panicked customer did come back for.

(Image: Getty Images)

Horse manure

Driving through the countryside, it’s not unusual to get some unwelcome scents wafting in through the windows from the fields.

However, for one buyer in Falkirk, the source of the problem was much closer to home - when they discovered a bag of horse manure in their car.

Other strange items that have been left behind in cars include:

Pack of 20 shotgun shells

An unused, boxed microwave

An ex-fiance’s engagement ring, attached to the spare key

An inflatable man

Head of technical services at webuyanycar.com, Richard Evans, said: ‘we always strive to go above and beyond for our customers and sometimes this means reuniting them with some strange items that have been left behind in cars.’

While items left behind only get more bizarre, he added: ‘One thing is always certain, no matter what your car may have been storing, we will be sure to buy it.’
description: Buying a new car is very exciting, but imagine opening the boot and finding one of these bizarre items sitting waiting for you...
